text: A number is increased by 25% to become 75. What is the original number?
A number is decreased by 10% and becomes 54. What was the number before the decrease?
A shirt originally costs x dollars. After a 30% discount, the sale price is $35. What was the original price?
A number is 40% of another number. If the larger number is 120, what is the smaller number?
A quantity increased by 12% becomes 112. What was the original quantity?
A student answered 60% of the questions correctly and got 24 correct. How many questions were on the test?
answerHint: Hint: Enter the total number of questions.

text: After a 20% price increase, the cost of a book becomes $30. What was the original price?
A number is 15% less than another number. If the larger number is 80, what is the smaller number?
A price of a toy increased from x to 69, which is a 15% increase. What was the original price?
A number is 80% of another number. If the smaller number is 64, what is the larger number?
A laptop originally priced at x dollars is discounted by 25% and now costs $450. What was the original price?
An investment increases by 8% and becomes $540. What was its original value?
A school has increased enrollment by 5% to reach 630 students. What was last year's enrollment?
A discount of 40% brings the price of a jacket down to $90. What was the original price?
A store marks up the price of an item by 10% to get a selling price of $44. What was the original price?
A number is 32% of another number. If the larger number is 250, what is the smaller number?
A number is increased by 18% to become 177. What was the original number?
A price decreased by 22% becomes $78. What was the original price?
A student scores 92% on an exam and earns 46 points. What was the total number of points?
A number is 150% of another number. If the larger number is 90, what is the smaller number?
